questions.question_text:
An administrator creates a content source to import three Cloud Assembly blueprints in to Service Broker. After some time, he is tasked with deleting the content source.
What would happen if and when this content source is deleted?

discussion.content:
Answer is C.
When you delete a content source, the imported items are deleted from the Service Broker catalog.

B 
From Student Book:
When you delete a content source, the imported items are deleted from the catalog. But the Cloud Assembly blueprints remain intact.

comments.content:
Your comment is true, but option B says "Only the content source is deleted but the blueprints remain intact in Service Broker." The blueprints do not stay intact in Service Broker, but they do stay intact in Cloud Assembly.

As such the answer is C
the imported items are deleted from the catalog (service broker ) so answer is C

discussion.content:
You can set up multi-organization tenancy for vRealize Automation using vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/8.4/Administering/GUID-1D0D01DB-F19C-4328-B24C-9CA4C58CDCE4.html

Before enabling tenancy, there are a number of prerequisites covered in the product documentation. Once the prerequisites are out of the way, you will enable tenancy in LCM. The initial Provider (default) Organization will change the URL you use to access VMware Identity Manager (aka vIDM and VMware Workspace One Access). The process to enable tenancy in vIDM and vRA will take about 30 minutes.
